name: convert_lead_to_candidate
description: Convert a lead to a candidate and remove the original lead.
examples: REX, convert this lead to a candidate.
REX, convert lead 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000 to a candidate.

name: sourceLeads
description: Source leads from Apollo or LinkedIn into a specific campaign.
examples: REX, source 10 product managers for this role.
REX, pull 20 Apollo leads for my SDR campaign.
REX, find top leads in my campaign who opened but didn't reply.

name: enrichLead
description: Enrich a lead using Apollo to find email and other data.
examples: REX, enrich this lead with a personal email.
REX, enrich this batch of leads with emails.
REX, enrich this lead with a verified email.

name: enrichLeadProfile
description: Find and enrich a lead's profile using name and LinkedIn URL to get comprehensive information including contact details, professional background, and more.
examples: REX, enrich John Smith's profile. LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/johnsmith
REX, enrich Jane Doe's profile with LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/jane-doe and email: jane@company.com
REX, enrich this candidate's profile: Sales Navigator: linkedin.com/sales/lead/123456
REX, find and enrich Mike Johnson's profile from LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/mikejohnson

name: sendMessage
description: Send or draft a personalized outreach message for a candidate.
examples: REX, write a 3-step cold email sequence for this candidate.
REX, create a follow-up message for someone who opened but didn't reply.

name: getPipelineStats
examples: REX, show me all candidates in the Phone Screen stage.
REX, who hasn't moved stages in 7 days?

name: moveCandidate
description: Move a candidate to a new stage in the hiring pipeline.
examples: REX, move Jane Smith to Final Interview.

name: triggerZapier
examples: REX, trigger the Zapier webhook for SDR follow-up.

name: triggerMakeWorkflow
examples: REX, trigger the Make.com SDR follow-up workflow.

name: fetchCredits
description: Return the current user's available and used credit balance.
examples: REX, how many credits do I have left?
REX, explain what's using the most credits this week.

name: openHelpArticle
description: Open or summarize a help center article inside the REX UI.
examples: REX, open the support article on LinkedIn cookies.

name: getEmailStatus
description: Check the delivery or open status of a previously sent email.
examples: REX, did my message to Jordan get delivered?
REX, test my SendGrid API key.

name: generateApiKey
description: Create (or retrieve) the user's API key for Zapier/Make integrations.
examples: REX, create my API key for integrations.
REX, do I have an API key already?

name: registerWebhook
description: Store a Zapier/Make Catch-Hook URL for a specific event and return the signing secret.
examples: REX, save this Zapier hook for lead.created events.
REX, use my Make URL for pipeline stage changes.

name: listZapierEndpoints
description: Return fully-qualified endpoint URLs for actions and triggers.
examples: REX, show me the API endpoints for Zapier.

name: listSenders
description: List available sender addresses (SendGrid, Google, Outlook) the user can choose from.
examples: REX, which email senders can I use?

name: scheduleBulkMessages
description: Schedule a templated email to multiple leads at a specific date/time.
examples: REX, schedule the SDR follow-up template for these 50 leads tomorrow at 9 AM using jobs@acme.co.

name: linkedin_connect
description: Queue LinkedIn connection requests to one or more profiles with optional personal message.
examples: REX, send LinkedIn requests to these 5 leads with a personal message.
REX, connect with this lead on LinkedIn.
REX, schedule LinkedIn connection requests for tomorrow at 10 AM.
Send LinkedIn request to this lead with message: 'Hi #firstName#, I'd love to connect...'
